title: Want to Win a Chip War? You’re Gonna Need a Lot of Water
description: The US is spending billions to boost semiconductor manufacturing. For the new plants to crank out silicon chips, they need to source millions of gallons of ultrapure water.

title: The Ukraine War Shows the US Military-Industrial Complex Isn’t Battle Ready
description: Meeting Ukraine’s vast demand for ammunition and weapons means tapping into a web of small manufacturers across America, and rethinking how military supply chains work.

title: Threads Is the New Cool Hangout—for Brands
description: With big names like Wendy’s and Netflix, brand-on-brand chatter is shaping Meta’s new social media app. That could leave little room for people.

title: A Vast Untapped Green Energy Source Is Hiding Beneath Your Feet
description: New experiments in the deserts of Utah and Nevada show how advances in fracking—technology developed by the oil industry—can be repurposed to tap clean geothermal energy anywhere on Earth.
